column11: Conduits: Every conduit needs at least ItemNumber, Material, NominalSize, Length.

column5: Unique part SKU or tag for this conduit type (e.g. “EMT‐3/4” )
Optional text description (e.g. “3/4″ EMT Sch. 40, galvanized”)
column11: Fittings/Elbows: Must include ItemNumber, Angle, Radius, Material, and link back to the parent conduit ID.
Cable Tray: Needs ItemNumber, Width, Depth, Material, Length.

column5: Length in feet (decimal); schedule pulls instance length
True if this instance is pre‐cut; else False
column11: Strut & Supports: Must have StrutProfile, StrutLength, RodLength, HardwareType.

column5: Link back to a spool/assembly ID (if this conduit is in a spool)

column11: Hardware: Must include HardwareCategory, Size, Material.

column5: If conduit is insulated (e.g. “Foam‐XP”); often blank
column11: Equipment: Must include EquipmentType and Quantity; ItemNumber is required.
Assemblies/Packages: Spool/Package ID and Name are mandatory to define a “Package” in Stratus.
Cut Lists: Each row is a cut piece—ItemNumber, CutLength, Material, Quantity, and must be tied to a ParentPackageID.

Below is the full, multi‐tab mapping template laid out in markdown. Each “tab” is presented as a separate section with its own table. You can copy these tables directly into Excel (or Google Sheets) to recreate the eight tabs (“Conduits,” “Fittings/Elbows,” “Cable Tray,” “Strut & Supports,” “Hardware,” “Equipment,” “Assemblies/Packages,” and “Cut Lists”). Each table uses the columns you requested:

column5: Link to the parent conduit’s ItemNumber or unique ID
Usually “1” for a single fitting; could be >1 for bundled fittings
If fitting requires an insert length; often blank for standard elbows
If this fitting belongs to a specific spool (assembly), map that spool ID here
Some teams prefer the Revit Type Mark as manufacturer part number (optional)

column11: Revit/Evolve Parameter (the shared parameter or family parameter to pull from)
Notes (any units, defaults, or special instructions)

column5: If the tray run is part of a specific spool/assembly ID
If it has a bend profile (e.g., “90° Bend, 12x6 Tray”)
If multiple identical lengths are grouped into one row
Threaded rod length in feet (if used as drop rod)
Bolt size (e.g., “3/8″ Bolt”), nut size, etc.
Number of threaded rods for this support
If this support belongs to a prefabricated spool/assembly
Hardware SKU or identifier (e.g., “BC‐3/8‐GALV” for beam clamp)
How many pieces in this line item
If hardware is within an assembly/spool (e.g., nut/bolt for tray)
Room, floor, or area where equipment is placed
If a sub-panel of a main panel, reference that main panel’s ID
Revit Family Type Mark (could match manufacturer model)

column11: # Define template structure for each tab with example fields

column5: User-friendly name for the spool (e.g., “Main Feed 1st Floor”)
Optional text (e.g., “Power feed to Building A, floor 1”)
If this is a sub-assembly, parent spool ID

column11: Notes: ["Unique part number", "Optional description", "e.g., EMT, RMC", "Nominal diameter in inches", "Length in feet", "Checked if part is cut"]

column5: Sum of lengths of all conduit segments in this spool (ft)
Length to be cut (in feet; decimal format)

column11: Notes: ["Fitting part number", "Description of fitting", "Angle in degrees", "Radius in inches", "e.g., EMT", "Link to parent conduit item"]

column5: How many identical cuts of this length are needed
The spool/assembly ID this cut belongs to
True if a fitting (e.g. coupling) must be pre‐installed
If a fitting is needed, specify (e.g., “Coupling‐Galv”, “Elbow‐90”)
Optional free-text (e.g., “Deburr both ends after cut”)
If this cut piece is nested under a larger prefab piece, map that parent part ID
“Horizontal” or “Vertical” if orientation matters for CNC ordering
column11: Revit/Evolve Parameter: ["eV_Tag_ItemNumber", "Type Comments", "Tray Width", "Tray Depth", "Tray Material", "Length"],
Notes: ["Tray SKU", "Optional tray description", "Width in inches", "Depth in inches", "e.g., Galvanized Steel", "Length in feet"]
Notes: ["Unique part number", "Optional description", "3-Hole, 4D, etc.", "Length of strut in feet", "Rod length in feet", "Beam clamp, channel nut, etc."]
Notes: ["Hardware SKU", "Optional description", "Clamp, Nut, Bolt", "Size designation", "Material type"]
Notes: ["Equipment SKU", "Optional description", "Panelboard, Transformer", "e.g., 120/208V", "Number of units", "Room or area"]
Notes: ["Unique spool/package ID", "Name of spool", "Optional description", "Straight, Tee, etc.", "Parent assembly linkage"]
Notes: ["Item number of cut part", "Length to cut in feet", "Material type", "Number of cuts", "Link to package/spool"]
